snippet: Donald J. Trump holds the lead in Republican polls, but he has already lost the man who controls many of the nation’s most important news outlets.
abstract: Longtime enmity between Donald Trump and Rupert Murdoch has led to Murdoch's leveraging his media empire to tear down Trump as he seeks to capture 2016 Republican presidential nomination; Trump, realizing small likelihood of winning over Murdoch, has set his sights on earning support of Fox News chairman and chief executive Roger E Ailes.

byline.original: By AMY CHOZICK and ASHLEY PARKER

lead_paragraph: Donald J. Trump holds the lead in Republican polls, but he has already lost the man who controls many of the nation’s most important news outlets.

headline.main: Titans Clash as Donald Trump’s Run Fuels His Feud With Rupert Murdoch
headline.print_headline: Titans Clash as Trump’s Run Fuels His Feud With Murdoch
